author: mandrenguyen
body:
#### PR description:

- Existing 2022 heavy-ion workflows (159.*) are duplicated for 2023 detector conditions (160.*).
- The center-of-mass energy is updated to 5.362 TeV, the energy expected for the 2023 Pb-Pb data.
- The Hydjet generator parameters are slightly modified to correspond to what will be used for 2023 MC production. 
- The vertex smearing for both 2022 and 2023 workflows are updated to realistic beam conditions derived from the 2022 data.
- The autoconditions are updated to global tags containing the corresponding reco BS.  See [here](https://cms-talk.web.cern.ch/t/request-for-new-run3-hi-mc-gt-realistic-bs-for-12-5-x/21522/5)
- The GT change includes the tag `BeamSpotObjects_Realistic2022PbPbCollision_v5_mc` as can be seen in the diffs:
https://cms-conddb.cern.ch/cmsDbBrowser/diff/Prod/gts/131X_mcRun3_2022_realistic_HI_v1/131X_mcRun3_2022_realistic_HI_v2
and
https://cms-conddb.cern.ch/cmsDbBrowser/diff/Prod/gts/131X_mcRun3_2023_realistic_HI_v1/131X_mcRun3_2023_realistic_HI_v2

- Relval wfs (322-324, 161.01) that use an input dataset are also added but commented out until input samples can be produced
- For 2022 workflows, cleaned up outdated nomenclature by fully changing `2021` to `2022`


#### PR validation:

wfs 160.0, 160.02, 160.03, 160.1, 160.2, 160.3 were tested with the option -j0.  The cmsDriver commands run successfully, but the cmsRun commands are left for the jenkins tests.

#### If this PR is a backport please specify the original PR and why you need to backport that PR. If this PR will be backported please specify to which release cycle the backport is meant for:

No backport will be needed.
title: HI 2023 relval wfs + realistic 2022 vtx smearing
